definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
the right time for sth/the right season (for planting cabbage)
to be in the prime of life
right in the midpoint/a bull's eye/to hit the nail on the head

sentences.english: Applying the market rule to electronic unfair competition disputes is not always easy.
sentences.chinese: 运用该市场规律来消除电子不正当竞争并不容易。

sentences.english: When fractional-reserve banks expand credit, malinvestments result.
sentences.chinese: 当部分储备银行扩张信贷是，不正当的投资产生了。

sentences.english: Whitelies should not be bred. No different in personality from a Corgi with proper markings, they make excellent pets.
sentences.chinese: 在个性和正当市场上没有区别，他们是优秀的宠物。

sentences.english: When proper guest is driven, chef and lackey leave suddenly however.
sentences.chinese: 正当客人驾到时，厨师和仆人却突然离去。

sentences.english: Just when you think that kiting can be for only a board, think again.
sentences.chinese: 正当你认为放风筝可以只有一板，再想一想。

sentences.english: While the boy was crossing the street, a car knocked him down.
sentences.chinese: 正当这小男孩穿马路的时候，一辆卡车把他撞倒了。

sentences.english: The second part mainly discusses the basis of justifiability of the presumptive consent.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分主要探讨了推定的承诺的正当化根据。

sentences.english: There was no proper data of any kind.
sentences.chinese: 但实际上没有任何形式的正当数据资料。

sentences.english: Be it lawful I love thee as thou lov'st those.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你，你爱他们，都一样正当。

sentences.english: Guess you can justify anything with words.
sentences.chinese: 想必适当措辞可以使一切正当化。

sentences.english: At last the litigants could easily interfere in cases, which hurts the fairness of justice.
sentences.chinese: 三是案件易受当事人不正当干预，影响司法公正。

sentences.english: I am about to stop when I hear a gun shot.
sentences.chinese: 正当我要停下来的时候，我听见一声枪响。

sentences.english: The general tried to justify the slaughter of the entire village.
sentences.chinese: 那名将军试图对屠村的暴行做出正当解释。

sentences.english: He said the excuse given was that there was no warrant.
sentences.chinese: 他说给出的解释是没有正当理由。

sentences.english: I feel this is meddlesome , if be proper exercise powers and authorities of office, what are you afraid of?
sentences.chinese: 我觉得这是好事，如果是正当行使职权，你怕什么？

sentences.english: First, I will not tolerate harassment or any other form of misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我不能容忍骚扰或任何其它形式的不正当行为。

definition: to be just about to/to be on the point of
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
original/originally/at first/it goes without saying/of course
